cards.name: Alert Shu Infantry
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Alert Shu Infantry to tap.
cards.flavor: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

cards.name: Ambition's Cost
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards. You lose 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"When you give offense to heaven, to whom can you pray?"

—Cao Cao, quoting Confucius

cards.name: Balance of Power
cards.text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
cards.originalText: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, you draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power it doesn't count as in your hand.)

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

cards.name: Barbarian General
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor:
"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."

—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Barbarian Horde
cards.flavor: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea:

Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

cards.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
cards.flavor: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

cards.name: Borrowing the East Wind
cards.text: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.
cards.originalText: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each player and each creature with horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures with horsemanship.)

cards.name: Brilliant Plan
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

cards.name: Broken Dam
cards.text: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.
cards.originalText: Tap any one or two creatures without horsemanship. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
cards.flavor: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

cards.name: Burning Fields
cards.text: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent.
cards.originalText: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to your opponent.
cards.flavor:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."

—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

cards.name: Burning of Xinye
cards.text: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.originalText: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

rulings.text: Burning of Xinye targets only an opponent. If that player is an illegal target by the time Burning of Xinye resolves, the entire spell is countered.
The lands that will be destroyed aren't chosen until Burning of Xinye resolves.

A land with a regeneration shield on it will regenerate from Burning of Xinye's destruction effect. However, the spell or ability that creates that shield must be cast or activated before Burning of Xinye starts to resolve.

In a multiplayer game, only lands controlled by two players (you and the targeted opponent) are destroyed. However, Burning of Xinye will deal 4 damage to each creature, even those controlled by other players.

As Burning of Xinye resolves, first you destroy four lands you control (all at the same time), then the targeted opponent destroys four lands he or she controls (all at the same time). That player chooses which of his or her lands to destroy. Neither of you can choose to destroy a land with indestructible.

cards.name: Cao Cao, Lord of Wei
cards.text: {T}: Target opponent discards two cards. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cao Cao to force your opponent to choose and discard two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Cao Ren, Wei Commander enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Cao Ren comes into play, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Capture of Jingzhou
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.
cards.originalText: You take another turn after this one.
cards.flavor: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

cards.name: Champion's Victory
cards.text:
Cast Champion's Victory only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Play Champion's Victory only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.

Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.originalText: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Your opponent discards that card.
cards.flavor: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

cards.name: Control of the Court
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.originalText: Draw four cards and put them into your hand. Then discard three cards at random from your hand.
cards.flavor: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

cards.name: Corrupt Court Official
cards.text: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: When Corrupt Official comes into play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

cards.name: Corrupt Eunuchs
cards.text: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText: When Corrupt Eunuchs comes into play, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only one with creatures, deal the damage to one of them.)

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it will have to target itself.

cards.name: Council of Advisors
cards.text: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.originalText: When Council of Advisors comes into play, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

cards.name: Counterintelligence
cards.text: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.originalText: Return any one or two creatures to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

cards.name: Cunning Advisor
cards.text: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cunning Advisor to force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Deception
cards.text: Target opponent discards two cards.
cards.originalText: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)
cards.flavor: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

cards.name: Desert Sandstorm
cards.text: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.
cards.originalText: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)
cards.flavor: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

cards.name: Desperate Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All your creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

rulings.text: Desperate Charge affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. A creature that enters the battlefield later in the turn won't get +2/+0.

cards.name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Diaochan to destroy any one creature. Then, your opponent destroys any one creature of his or her choice.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
cards.text: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.
cards.originalText: When Dong Zhou comes into play, choose one of your opponent's creatures. That creature deals damage to him or her equal to its power. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any creatures in play.)

cards.name: Eightfold Maze
cards.text:
Cast Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.originalText:
Play Eightfold Maze only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.

Destroy any one attacking creature.

rulings.text: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Eightfold Maze. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
If you're able to cast Eightfold Maze, it can target any attacking creature (including one attacking a planeswalker).

cards.name: Empty City Ruse
cards.text: Target opponent skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
cards.originalText: Your opponent can't attack on his or her next turn.
cards.flavor: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

cards.name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.
cards.originalText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Only that creature can block this turn.
cards.flavor: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.
cards.flavor: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.name: Extinguish
cards.text: Counter target sorcery spell.
cards.originalText:
Play Extinguish only in response to another player playing a sorcery.

That sorcery has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: False Defeat
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Take any one creature card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.
cards.flavor:
"All warfare is based on deception."

—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

cards.name: False Mourning
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.originalText: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.
cards.flavor: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

cards.name: Famine
cards.text: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
cards.flavor: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

cards.name: Fire Ambush
cards.text: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
cards.flavor: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

cards.name: Fire Bowman
cards.text: Sacrifice Fire Bowman: Fire Bowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may destroy Fire Bowman to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Flanking Troops
cards.text: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.originalText: When Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
cards.flavor: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

cards.name: Forced Retreat
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.originalText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."

—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: G
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: G
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: G
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Forest Bear
cards.flavor:
Fish and bear paws—one can't have both.

—Chinese idiom meaning

"you can't have it both ways"

cards.name: Ghostly Visit
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.
cards.flavor: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

cards.name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures.
cards.originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. (This includes your tapped creatures.)
cards.flavor: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

cards.name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Guan Yu is put into your graveyard from play, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
If Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into your library.
If a replacement effect has Guan Yu move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

cards.name: Heavy Fog
cards.text:
Cast Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
cards.originalText:
Play Heavy Fog only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.

This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

rulings.text: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Heavy Fog. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
Heavy Fog prevents only damage that would be dealt to you by attacking creatures. It won't prevent damage attacking creatures would deal to creatures or planeswalkers you control.

Heavy Fog prevents all damage attacking creatures would deal to you this turn, not just combat damage. Noncombat damage from those creatures is prevented only if they're still attacking at the time that damage would be dealt or, if the creature has left the battlefield by then, if it was an attacking creature at the time it left.

cards.name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician
cards.text: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Hua Tuo to put any one creature card from your graveyard on the top of your library.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Huang Zhong, Shu General
cards.text: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.originalText: Huang Zhong can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Virile in war, he kept the north in fear;

His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

cards.name: Hunting Cheetah
cards.text: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Hunting Cheetah successfully damages your opponent, you may search your library for a forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Hunting Cheetah's ability allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Forest, not just a card with the name Forest.

cards.name: Imperial Edict
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.
cards.originalText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature.
cards.flavor: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emperor Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

cards.name: Imperial Recruiter
cards.text: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power no greater than 2, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

cards.name: Imperial Seal
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.originalText: Search your library for any one card. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

cards.name: Independent Troops
cards.flavor: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: U
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: U
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: U
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Kongming's Contraptions
cards.text: {T}: Kongming's Contraptions deals 2 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
cards.originalText: After you're attacked, before you declare blockers, you may tap Kongming's Contraptions to have it deal 2 damage to any one attacking creature.

cards.name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All your other creatures get +1/+1 as long as Kongming is in play.
cards.flavor:
"Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—

Had never been, nor ever was again."

cards.name: Lady Sun
cards.text: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lady Sun to return it and any one other creature to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor:
"A man, and such a fool I, a woman, will fight them for you."

—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

As long as you have Guan Yu and/or Zhang Fei in play, Liu Bei gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."

—Liu Bei

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.originalText: When Lone Wolf attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.name: Loyal Retainers
cards.text: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack you may put Loyal Retainers in your graveyard to take any one Legend card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
cards.text: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Lu Bu is unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Lu Meng, Wu General
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lu Su to draw a card.
cards.flavor: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Lu Xun successfully damages your opponent, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Lu Xun's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

cards.name: Ma Chao, Western Warrior
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it can't be blocked this combat.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Whenever Ma Chao attacks and no other creatures do, Ma Chao can't be blocked.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Marshaling the Troops
cards.text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.
cards.originalText: Tap any number of your creatures. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

cards.name: Meng Huo's Horde
cards.flavor: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

cards.name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
cards.text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All your other green creatures get +1/+1 as long as Meng Huo is in play.
cards.flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

cards.name: Misfortune's Gain
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.
cards.flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

rulings.text: The creature's *owner* gains the life, regardless of who happens to control it.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.text: R
cards.originalText: R
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mountain
cards.text: R
cards.originalText: R
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mountain
cards.text: R
cards.originalText: R
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mountain Bandit
cards.text: Haste
cards.originalText: Mountain Bandit is unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

cards.name: Mystic Denial
cards.text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
cards.originalText: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Overwhelming Forces
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.originalText: Destroy all your opponent's creatures. you draw a card for each creature destroyed in this way.
cards.flavor: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

cards.name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Pang Tong to give any one creature +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme

That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Peach Garden Oath
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
cards.originalText: For each creature you have in play, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."

—Peach Garden Oath

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W
cards.originalText: W
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W
cards.originalText: W
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Plains
cards.text: W
cards.originalText: W
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Poison Arrow
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

cards.name: Preemptive Strike
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.originalText:
Play Preemptive Strike only in response to another player playing a creature card.

That creature has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Rally the Troops
cards.text:
Cast Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Untap all creatures you control.
cards.originalText:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.

Untap all your creatures.

cards.name: Ravages of War
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)
cards.flavor: "Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

cards.name: Ravaging Horde
cards.text: When Ravaging Horde enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.originalText: When Ravaging Horde comes into play, destroy any one land.
cards.flavor: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

cards.name: Red Cliffs Armada
cards.text: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.originalText: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
cards.flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.
cards.flavor: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.name: Renegade Troops
cards.text: Haste
cards.originalText: Renegade Troops is unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

cards.name: Return to Battle
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Return any one creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

cards.name: Riding Red Hare
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

cards.name: Riding the Dilu Horse
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: Any one creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship.
cards.flavor:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."

—Liu Bei, after being told that the

Dilu brings its master ill fortune

rulings.text: The spell's effect has no duration. The targeted creature gets +2/+2 until the game ends or it leaves the battlefield. It has horsemanship until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose horsemanship.

cards.name: Rockslide Ambush
cards.text: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.originalText: Rockslide Ambush deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountain cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountain cards.)

cards.name: Rolling Earthquake
cards.text: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.
cards.originalText: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures without horsemanship.)

cards.name: Sage's Knowledge
cards.text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Return any one sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."

—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

(trans. Feng and English)

cards.name: Shu Cavalry
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Shu Defender
cards.text: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

cards.name: Shu Elite Companions
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Shu Elite Infantry
cards.flavor: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

cards.name: Shu Farmer
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Shu Farmer to gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."

—A Shu diplomat

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Shu Foot Soldiers
cards.flavor: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that the he began to truly succeed as a leader.

cards.name: Shu General
cards.text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Attacking doesn't cause Shu General to tap.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Shu Grain Caravan
cards.text: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: When Shu Grain Caravan comes into play, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

cards.name: Shu Soldier-Farmers
cards.text: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.originalText: When Shu Soldier-Farmers comes into play, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

cards.name: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal
cards.text: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.originalText: Sima Yi has power equal to the number of swamp cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped swamp cards.)
cards.flavor: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.

cards.name: Slashing Tiger
cards.text: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When Slashing Tiger attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."  

—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

rulings.text: When Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, the ability will trigger just once no matter how many creatures are blocking it.

cards.name: Southern Elephant
cards.flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

cards.name: Spoils of Victory
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Spoils of Victory allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest, not just a card with one of those names.

cards.name: Spring of Eternal Peace
cards.text: You gain 8 life.
cards.originalText: You gain 8 life.
cards.flavor: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.originalText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
cards.flavor: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

cards.name: Stolen Grain
cards.text: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent. You gain 5 life.
cards.originalText: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to your opponent. You gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

rulings.text: If the targeted opponent is an illegal target by the time Stolen Grain resolves, the ability is countered. You won't gain life.

cards.name: Stone Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Stone Catapult to destroy any one tapped creature that isn't black.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one land.
cards.flavor: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

cards.name: Strategic Planning
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, you look at all of them, put one of them into your hand, and put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Straw Soldiers
cards.flavor: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

cards.name: Sun Ce, Young Conquerer
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Sun Ce, Young Conquerer enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Sun Ce comes into play, you may return any one creature from play to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Sun Quan, Lord of Wu
cards.text: Creatures you control have horsemanship. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: All your creatures gain horsemanship as long as Sun Quan is in play. (This includes Sun Quan.)
cards.flavor: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Sun Quan's ability affects Sun Quan itself.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.text: B
cards.originalText: B
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Swamp
cards.text: B
cards.originalText: B
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Swamp
cards.text: B
cards.originalText: B
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Taoist Hermit
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.originalText: Whenever your opponent chooses a creature in play, he or she can't choose Taoist Hermit.
cards.flavor: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

cards.name: Taoist Mystic
cards.text: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
cards.originalText: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
cards.flavor: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

cards.name: Taunting Challenge
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.originalText: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to block it do so.
cards.flavor: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

cards.name: Three Visits
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that forest into play. Shuffle your library afterward.
cards.flavor:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."

—Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Three Visits allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Forest, not just a card with the name Forest.

cards.name: Trained Cheetah
cards.text: Whenever Trained Cheetah becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When Trained Cheetah attacks and is blocked, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: "King Mulu's cheetahs came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

cards.name: Trained Jackal
cards.flavor: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

cards.name: Trip Wire
cards.text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one creature with horsemanship.
cards.flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy any one tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced."

—Liu Bei, on the death of

his oath-brother Guan Yu

cards.name: Virtuous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

cards.name: Volunteer Militia
cards.flavor: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

cards.name: Warrior's Oath
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.originalText: Take another turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game. (You don't lose if you've already won.)
cards.flavor:
"If I fail, my head is yours."

—Warrior's oath common

during the Three Kingdoms period

cards.name: Warrior's Stand
cards.text:
Cast Warrior's Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Play Warrior's Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.

All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Wei Ambush Force
cards.text: Whenever Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city—and later his life—to Cao Cao.

cards.name: Wei Assassins
cards.text: When Wei Assassins enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.
cards.originalText: When Wei Assassins comes into play, your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has no creatures in play.)

cards.name: Wei Elite Companions
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wei Infantry
cards.flavor: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

cards.name: Wei Night Raiders
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Wei Night Raiders deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Wei Night Raiders successfully damages your opponent, he or she chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Wei Night Raiders's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

cards.name: Wei Scout
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor:
He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared."

—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wei Strike Force
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wielding the Green Dragon
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

cards.name: Wolf Pack
cards.text: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.originalText: When Wolf Pack attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.name: Wu Admiral
cards.text: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
cards.originalText: As long as your opponent has an island in play, Wu Admiral gets +1/+1.
cards.flavor: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

cards.name: Wu Elite Cavalry
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wu Infantry
cards.flavor: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

cards.name: Wu Light Cavalry
cards.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText: Horsemanship
cards.flavor: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wu Longbowman
cards.text: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Wu Longbowman to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Wu Scout
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Wu Scout enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Wu Scout comes into play, look at your opponent's hand.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Wu Spy
cards.text: When Wu Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put one of them into his or her graveyard.
cards.originalText: When Wu Spy comes into play, look at the top two cards of any player's library. Put one of them on the top of that player's library and the other in his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Wu Warship
cards.text: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.originalText: Wu Warship can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
cards.flavor: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

cards.name: Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

On your turn, before you attack, you may put Xiahou Dun into your graveyard to return a black card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
You can't activate Xiahou Dun's ability to return Xiahou Dun itself to your hand. You must choose a target before you sacrifice Xiahou Dun, so it's not a black card in your graveyard yet.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Xun Yu, Wei Advisor
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Xun Yu to give one of your creatures +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: "A splendid talent, admired of all men His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Yellow Scarves Cavalry
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Yellow Scarves General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Yellow Scarves General can't block.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Yellow Scarves General can't block.
cards.flavor: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Yellow Scarves Troops
cards.text: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.
cards.originalText: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.
cards.flavor: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

cards.name: Young Wei Recruits
cards.text: Young Wei Recruits can't block.
cards.originalText: Young Wei Recruits can't block.
cards.flavor:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."

—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

cards.name: Yuan Shao's Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks alone, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked this combat.
cards.originalText: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks and no other creatures do, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked.

cards.name: Yuan Shao, the Indecisive
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Each of your creatures can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn as long as Yuan Shao is in play.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
cards.text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

Attacking doesn't cause Zhang Fei to tap.
cards.flavor: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Zhang He, Wei General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Zhang He, Wei General attacks, each other creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Zhang He attacks, all your other creatures get +1/+0 until the end of the turn.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei
cards.text: Whenever Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei deals damage to an opponent, that opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: When Zhang Liao successfully damages your opponent, he or she chooses and discard a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

cards.name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Horsemanship

When Zhao Zilong blocks, it gets +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
cards.flavor: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. He twice rescued Liu Bei's son and heir, Liu Shan.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

cards.name: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander
cards.text: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.originalText: Zhou Yu can't attack unless your opponent has an island in play.
cards.flavor:
"After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?"

—Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

cards.name: Zhuge Jin, Wu Strategist
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Zhuge Jin to make any one creature unblockable this turn.
cards.flavor: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.name: Zodiac Dog
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has a mountain in play, Zodiac Dog can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north—in vain. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Dragon
cards.text: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.
cards.originalText: If Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard, you may return Zodiac Dragon to your hand.
cards.flavor: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

rulings.text: If Zodiac Dragon is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, you can't return it to your hand. Similarly, if a replacement effect has Zodiac Dragon move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.
Even though Zodiac Dragon is a Dragon, it doesn't have flying.

cards.name: Zodiac Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has a mountain in play, Zodiac Goat can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Horse
cards.text: Islandwalk
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player has an island in play, Zodiac Horse can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . ‘First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Monkey
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodaic Monkey can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor:
". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi

Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Ox can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Pig
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Pig can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Rabbit
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodiac Hare can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Rat
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Rat can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Rooster
cards.text: Plainswalk
cards.originalText: Plainswalk (If defending player has a plain in play, Zodiac Rooster can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he Kongming not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Snake
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Snake can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

cards.name: Zodiac Tiger
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodiac Tiger can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: ". . . Three kings no more—Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

cards.name: Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
cards.originalText:
Zuo Ci can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.

Whenever your opponent chooses a creature in play, he or she can't choose Zuo Ci.
